intro.description: In this cheatsheet we will see how to add a field to a report by editing the query of its main dataset. To add a field we have to edit the query of the main dataset of the report. For this cheatsheet it is supposed to have a report opened that use the Sample Database as datasource.

item.title: Open a report
item.description: Open a report with a SQL data adapter into the main data source

item.title: Edit the report query
item.description: For this step you need to open the report main query. Click on the report element in the Outline view and from the Properties view hit the button "Edit query, filter and sort options"

item.title: Edit the query
item.description: Edit the query and hit the button "Read Fields" to search for new fields related to the query. This button will add all the available fields from the provided query

item.title: Edit the fields and confirm
item.description: Eventually remove or edit a field and hit Ok
